cause.description:
Special Olympics Wisconsin (SOWI) is a statewide organization providing persons with cognitive disabilities year-round sports training and competition. Individuals who are at least eight years old and are identified as having a cognitive disability are eligible for participation.
There are nearly 10,000 athletes who participate in Special Olympics in Wisconsin. 72 organized competitions are held annually including 5 state games. This is all possible due to financial contributions and volunteer efforts from the community.
Please consider supporting Special Olympics with a donation or to learn more about volunteer opportunities, visit http://www.specialolympicswisconsin.org
1. Children and adults with cognitive disabilities who participate in Special Olympics develop improved physical fitness and motor skills, greater self-confidence and a more positive self-image.
cause.mission: Raise money and awareness for Special Olympics Wisconsin
cause.name: Special Olympics Wisconsin
